item.title: Research Recap | Neural network modeling reveals diverse human exploration behaviors via state space analysis
item.description: Speaker Huadong Xiong Bio I am a first-year Ph.D student in the CNS program, the department of psychology at the University of Arizona, directed by Dr. Robert Wilson. I build models to understand behaviors and I study how computation could be implemented in neural networks. Following the release of GPT-4, my research interest has partially shifted towards understanding the emergence of intelligence within large language models. Abstract The exploration-exploitation trade-off, balancing the acquisition of new information with the utilization of known resources, is a fundamental dilemma faced by all adaptive intelligence.
